extracted_data_phrases: while knowingly in a state of sin
blasphemy.question: Did I receive Holy Communion while knowingly in a state of sin, thus profaning the real presence of Christ?
blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

extracted_data_phrases: perhaps through my thoughts or actions in various aspects of my life
in various aspects of my life
ambition.question: Did I let my desire for power and control over others influence my decisions and treatment of them, perhaps through my thoughts or actions in various aspects of my life?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

ambition.question: Did my desire for power and dominance influence the way I relate to, support, and serve others in my life?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

extracted_data_phrases: through volunteering , social events , or community service
over the well - being and needs of others
ambition.question: Did my pursuit of recognition and influence through volunteering, social events, or community service allow me to prioritize my own desires over the well-being and needs of others?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

greed.question: Did I make accumulation of possessions my driving force, replacing trust in God's providence?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

extracted_data_phrases: by my words , actions , or presence ,
oppression.question: Have I by my words, actions, or presence, contributed to others being mistreated?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

extracted_data_phrases: to my own efforts or abilities
autonomy.question: Did I take for granted the good things in my life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence, and instead attribute them to my own efforts or abilities?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

envy.question: Have I felt envy towards others' successes, wishing them would lose their accomplishments?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

extracted_data_phrases: in ways that violated their dignity through my words
incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control when speaking to others in ways that violated their dignity through my words?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and speak to others with hurtful or unbecoming words?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: in using words that were hurtful to others
incontinence.question: Did you lack self-control in using words that were hurtful to others?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: even in moderation that was reasonable for your physical needs
gluttony.question: Did you overindulge in eating or drinking, even in moderation that was reasonable for your physical needs?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
with loved ones , such as grandchildren
gluttony.question: Did you overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, especially when spending time with loved ones, such as grandchildren?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in excessive and wasteful gambling over fulfilling my responsibilities to support my family 's needs
over fulfilling my responsibilities to support my family 's needs
prodigality.question: Have I prioritized indulging in excessive and wasteful gambling over fulfilling my responsibilities to support my family's needs?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

extracted_data_phrases: for entertainment or leisure activities to take precedence over my financial obligations or family needs
over my financial obligations or family needs
on things that are not essential
prodigality.question: Have I allowed my desire for entertainment or leisure activities to take precedence over my financial obligations or family needs, leading me to spend excessively on things that are not essential?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

prodigality.question: Have I recklessly risked financial resources entrusted to me, prioritizing personal indulgences over essential family needs?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

extracted_data_phrases: in speaking about others ' private affairs
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in speaking about others' private affairs, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: such as family members , neighbors , or fellow volunteers
anger.question: Have I nursed anger against those closest to me, such as family members, neighbors, or fellow volunteers, rather than seeking reconciliation?
anger.description: Uncontrolled anger corrupts our own heart, damages our relationship with both God and neighbor.
